column4: What's your experience with RAIDS and Ubuntu? Mine has been to set up the RAID in the card and the BIOS takes care of the rest (Although, I think the OS still sees the physical disks and knows it's a raid).
- if it is a real hardware raid, then the OS doesnt need to know anything. It just sees a single disk
- on those semi hardware onboard raids, your OS just needs to have the driver. Pure software raids i never tried. I know OsX allows you to create software raids right in the partitioning process
- the advantage i see is that you do not have to setup drivers, otherwise modern cpus are fast enough to handle software raids easily
